segments.pli: Atha kho nandiyo paribbājako yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodi.
segments.en: Then the wanderer Nandiya went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.

segments.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho nandiyo paribbājako bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side, and said to the Buddha:

segments.pli: “kati nu kho, bho gotama, dhammā bhāvitā bahulīkatā nibbānaṅgamā honti nibbānaparāyanā nibbānapariyosānā”ti?
segments.en: “Master Gotama, how many things, when developed and cultivated, have extinguishment as their culmination, destination, and end?”

segments.pli: “Aṭṭhime kho, nandiya, dhammā bhāvitā bahulīkatā nibbānaṅgamā honti nibbānaparāyanā nibbānapariyosānā.
segments.en: “These eight things, when developed and cultivated, have extinguishment as their culmination, destination, and end.
They are: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.

segments.pli: Ime kho, nandiya, aṭṭha dhammā bhāvitā bahulīkatā nibbānaṅgamā honti nibbānaparāyanā nibbānapariyosānā”ti.
segments.en: These eight things, when developed and cultivated, have extinguishment as their culmination, destination, and end.”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, nandiyo paribbājako bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When he said this, the wanderer Nandiya said to the Buddha,

segments.pli: “abhikkantaṃ, bho gotama, abhikkantaṃ, bho gotama … pe …
upāsakaṃ maṃ bhavaṃ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṃ saraṇaṃ gatan”ti.
segments.en: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”

suttaplex.blurb: The wanderer Nandiya asks how many things lead to extinguishment.
